riddles.question: What has keys but can't open locks?
What gets wetter as it dries?
What has a head, a tail, but no body?
What can you catch but not throw?
What has one eye but can't see?
What is always in front of you but can't be seen?
What has many teeth but can't bite?
What is full of holes but still holds water?
What has a neck but no head?
What can travel around the world while staying in a corner?
What has hands but cannot clap?
What runs but never walks?
What has a bed but never sleeps?
What has a face and two hands but no arms or legs?
What goes up but never comes down?
What has words but never speaks?
What has a thumb and four fingers but is not alive?
What can fill a room but takes up no space?
What breaks when you say its name?
What has legs but cannot walk?

logics.question: If today is Monday, tomorrow is Tuesday. True or False?
A cat is an animal. True or False?
Water is dry. True or False?
All apples are red. True or False?
5 is greater than 3. True or False?
If A > B and B > C, then A > C. True or False?
A square has 3 sides. True or False?
The sun rises in the east. True or False?
Fish can fly. True or False?
2 + 2 = 4. True or False?
A triangle has 3 corners. True or False?
Ice is hot. True or False?
10 is an even number. True or False?
Humans need oxygen to breathe. True or False?
A year has 12 months. True or False?
Birds are mammals. True or False?
7 is less than 15. True or False?
A circle has corners. True or False?
The earth is flat. True or False?
A week has 7 days. True or False?
